info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 24 at 4:43AM CDT until May 24 at 8:45AM CDT by NWS Memphis TN
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of West Tennessee, including the following county, Shelby.
* WHEN...Until 845 AM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 443 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Bartlett, Germantown, Memphis, Midtown Memphis, Frayser, Downtown Memphis, Southeast Memphis, Ellendale, Raleigh, Woodstock, White Station, Benjestown, Elmore Park, Spring Lake, Parkway Village and Presidents Island. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 845 AM CDT THIS MORNING
